channel.title: About the Pi on JEFFRIS
channel.description: Recent content in About the Pi on JEFFRIS

item.title: Task Management
item.description: Opening the Task Manager A task manager is important for remotely managing your scripts on the Raspberry Pi. Because the Raspberry Pi has a weak processor, it is ideal to use a terminal based task manager to end unnecessary tasks, like scripts that have already completed. After you SSH into the raspberry pi, open a terminal and write ps aux This will list all of the tasks running on the Raspberry Pi.
